page.title: 09A Village Buys Its Castle.
page.content: The Norman castle of Dinas Powis stands close to the village. It was held from the 12th century by the De Sumeri family. Today the castle consists of a ruined and overgrown keep enclosed by a wall up to 30ft high. The main gateways are to the south and east. Legend informs us that the castle was captured by the Welsh, retaken by the English and attacked in the 15th century by Owain Glyndwr. This was followed by yet another assault by Cromwell in the 17th century. The castle was bought by the local Civic Trust in 1982. The chairman said " We are conserving our heritage and creating an amenity which will balance the spread of modern housing which characterises a dormitory village such as Dinas Powis today. "
